physical_appearance: "The image displays a photograph album, together with numerous photographs arranged and spread out into two rows. The front cover of the album is red in colour and the spine is black. There is a yellow string running through the spine. ""Photo album"" is stated in black font on the front of the photograph album cover. The cover looks worn out at the edges. "
sgcool_label_text: This photo album contain various images of Singapore that were taken during Robert Arthur Polglaze's time in Singapore during the 1940s. Polglaze signed with the Judge Advocate General's section when was 16 years old, and was posted to Singapore about a year later. He was posted to Singapore during the latter stages of the Japanese Occupation, as he was present in the room of the Japanese Surrender as seen in some of the photographs of the surrender proceedings. Other photographs in the album also include scenes of the Singapore River, Katong and Collyer Quay.
title_text: Photography Album (donation from Anthony Robert Saint Claire)
